channel.title: Cybersecurity News Aggregator
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity news from top sources
channel.comment: News aggregated from: Krebs on Security, The Hacker News, Threatpost, Bleeping Computer, Dark Reading

item.title: Attackers Harvest Dropbox Logins Via Fake PDF Lures
item.description: A malware-free phishing campaign targets corporate inboxes and asks employees to view "request orders," ultimately leading to Dropbox credential theft....

item.title: New GlassWorm attack targets macOS via compromised OpenVSX extensions
item.description: A new GlassWorm malware attack through compromised OpenVSX extensions focuses on stealing passwords, crypto-wallet data, and developer credentials and configurations from macOS systems. [...]...

item.title: County Pays $600K to Wrongfully Jailed Pen Testers
item.description: Iowa police arrested two penetration testers in 2019 for doing their jobs, highlighting the risk to security professionals in red teaming exercises....

item.title: Russian hackers exploit recently patched Microsoft Office bug in attacks

item.title: Malicious MoltBot skills used to push password-stealing malware
item.description: More than 230 malicious packages for the personal AI assistant OpenClaw (formerly known as Moltbot and ClawdBot) have been published in less than a week on the tool's official registry and on GitHub. ...

item.title: Researchers Find 341 Malicious ClawHub Skills Stealing Data from OpenClaw Users
item.description: A security audit of 2,857 skills on ClawHub has found 341 malicious skills across multiple campaigns, according to new findings from Koi Security, exposing users to new supply chain risks. ClawHub is ...

item.title: OpenClaw Bug Enables One-Click Remote Code Execution via Malicious Link

item.title: CTM360 Report Warns of Global Surge in Fake High-Yield Investment Scams
item.description: Fake high-yield investment platforms are surging worldwide, promising "guaranteed" returns that mask classic Ponzi schemes.CTM360 explains how HYIP scams scale through social media, recycled templates...

item.description: Chinese state-sponsored threat actors were likely behind the hijacking of Notepad++ update traffic last year that lasted for almost half a year, the developer states in an official announcement today....

item.title: Panera Bread breach impacts 5.1 million accounts, not 14 million customers
item.description: The data breach notification service Have I Been Pwned says that a data breach at the U.S. food chain Panera Bread affected 5.1 million accounts, not 14 million customers as previously reported. [...]...
